basics.name: Mehdi Hasan
basics.label: Data & Distributed Systems Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced software systems engineer with 14+ years spanning networking, mobile, backend, and cloud — now specialized in distributed data systems and large-scale architectures. Proven track record in building real-time data platforms, streaming pipelines, and high-performance storage/analytics systems using Python, Java, and modern cloud ecosystems (GCP certified: Architect, Data Engineer, Developer). Hands-on expertise in IoT data ingestion & integration, distributed databases (ClickHouse, Postgres, Elastic), and event-driven systems (Kafka, Solace, RabbitMQ). Skilled in mentoring teams, onboarding newcomers, and raising the technical bar — while remaining deeply hands-on with system design and problem solving. Passionate about distributed systems, data-intensive applications, and continuous learning, with a long-term goal of designing the next generation of scalable, data-driven platforms.

work.summary: Axis Communications AB is global industry leader in video surveillance and intelligent security solutions.
highlights: Working in the Data Infrastructure & System Insights area, designing and developing data platforms to collect, process, store, and analyze device telemetry at scale.
Successfully put the system into production, enabling scalable ingestion and monitoring of device telemetry data.
Broke down data silos by creating ETL pipelines from legacy platforms into a modern distributed system, unlocking cross-team access to insights.
Led the design, development, and rollout of migration strategy from legacy to modern data systems, improving reliability and future scalability.

TECH: Data Engineering, Linux, Embedded Systems, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Clickhouse, Redis, GitOps, Microservices, Kubernetes, Python, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Prometheus.io, Grafana, Containerization, SQL, Git, REST API, Jenkins, Docker, API Development, DevOps

Developed and optimized Kafka Connect plugins, SMTs, and streaming apps supporting global-scale data flows.

Built microservices in Spring Boot, Kotlin, and Python Flask for business-critical integrations.
Automated operational workflows with Ansible and CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins (Groovy, Bash).
Introduced KSQL-based stream processing for real-time message transformations.

TECH: Java, Kotlin, Python, Spring Boot, Strimzi Kafka, Kafka Connect, KSQL, Solace Event Mesh, Oracle, PostgreSQL, GCP (Pub/Sub, Cloud Run, GKE), Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, Ansible, Jenkins, Prometheus, Grafana, Splunk.

certification.area: The badge earner demonstrates an understanding of Supervised vs. Unsupervised Learning, applications of different types of machine learning models, and how to build and evaluate machine learning models.

This credential earner demonstrates knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) concepts, such as natural language processing, computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, chatbots, and neural networks; AI ethics; and the applications of AI. The individual has a conceptual understanding of how to run an AI model using IBM Watson Studio. The earner is aware of the job outlook in fields that use AI and is familiar with the skills required for success in various roles in the domain.
This badge earner is able to code in Python for data science. They can analyze and visualize data with Python with packages like scikit-learn, matplotlib and bokeh.

The badge earner has the foundational understanding of event-driven architecture (EDA), best practices associated with event-driven methodology, and how to apply them both to their applications and infrastructure as a whole. With the hands-on activities, the earner has the knowledge to get started with the Event Portal, to design and document event driven applications, events and event flows.
certification.studyType: Solace Certified Event Driven Architecture Practitioner

certification.area: A Professional Data Engineer enables data-driven decision making by collecting, transforming, and publishing data. A data engineer should be able to design, build, operationalize, secure, and monitor data processing systems with a particular emphasis on security and compliance; scalability and efficiency; reliability and fidelity; and flexibility and portability. A Data Engineer should also be able to leverage, deploy, and continuously train pre-existing machine learning models.
certification.studyType: Google Cloud Certified Professional Data Engineer

certification.area: A Professional Cloud Developer builds scalable and highly available applications using Google-recommended tools and best practices. This individual has experience with cloud-native applications, developer tools, managed services, and next-generation databases. A Professional Cloud Developer also has proficiency with at least one general-purpose programming language and instruments their code to produce metrics, logs, and traces.

A Google Cloud Certified - Professional Cloud Architect enables organizations to leverage Google Cloud technologies. Through an understanding of cloud architecture and Google technology, this individual can design, develop, and manage robust, secure, scalable, highly available, and dynamic solutions to drive business objectives.
